website_summaries.verdict: In spite of it not being manufactured by a well-known brand, this 50-inch TV has a lot to offer, including Fire technology and a reasonable price.
pros: Fire edition model that makes app streaming easy
TV is simple to set up, and interface isn't overly complicated to navigate
One of the more affordable models we considered
cons: Some reports of software and pairing issues

customer_reviews.title: Some Technical Difficulties
customer_reviews.text: I love the size and quality of the video. That being said I have the CBS and Sling App downloaded, and once to two times a month I have to delete and reinstall the apps. I am sure it has more to do with the apps however; the bugs in the compatability between the TV and the apps may not all be worked out. Also, once in a while the screen gets these green lines all on the right side of the screen. Also, the volume of the TV is very low. I would recommend buying a sound bar or a surround sound system.
customer_reviews.author: Babiegirrl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for the sale price.
customer_reviews.text: Had the TV for about 5 months now. No issues with the quality so far. The main issue I have is that the remote layout is situated slightly different than the fire TV remotes. Out of habit I sometimes hit the wrong buttons. For continuity reasons I would have preferred that the remote have the same layout. I also have had issues with linking my Sony exterior speakers and subwoofer. Sometimes it will sync, but sometimes it does not. A little annoying. Overall I feel like I got a great smart TV for the price. I think I wouldn't hesitate to pay the full price either.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Having too many apps Installed and heavy app usage might slow the TV down. I recommend you get a Playstation or another processor to do all the hard work. I've noticed that when ever you have alot of apps Installed and use them for a month or two, it tends to slow the TV down. Keep Minimum apps on the TV and or use a console through the Hmdi (ps4, xbox 1 or laptop/smartphone) to navigate through apps you should be fine. Factory reset it if it's already slow makes it works like new!. Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Baeza Díaz

customer_reviews.title: Budget friendly
customer_reviews.text: Good for a secondary or 3rd television. Its affordable you can jailbreak it to get free content I like it it's not perfect the color isn't great but for price and size its fine. It doesn't look like 4k though this is definitely a low budget tv I bought it for the living room for tv and movies mostly. It's for my 7 year old and I to share I have 3 other tvs in the house this is the 4th. Two are Samsung smart TVs one is 4k and the other is just a smart tv. We also have a TLC roku tv.
customer_reviews.author: Lady Jerzy

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: I will never but a tv like this again nor would I reccomend it. The remote is worthless it came brand new with buttons that are useless due to the software they are linked to being gone. There is also no way to get to settings without having to manually go into the settings of the tv. You cannot do it with the remote. Making it a hassle having to adjust the brightness from the big options. ****update****** Remote control has several buttons that have stopped working and some that only work part time never again will I buy a TV like this.
customer_reviews.author: Northcoastbarbie

customer_reviews.title: Happy Happy
customer_reviews.text: This was a breeze to hook up. 10 minutes from box to connecting, to enjoying. All the apps I need, looks the same as when I was using my fire-stick. The sound is great on it’s own but I have a sound bar. Picture crystal clear, no issues. Easy to jump between cable, streaming and antenna. Only one regret, should have went up to a 55”. Not much difference between the 42 and 50”. Not too much of a hardship 😀
customer_reviews.author: Suze

customer_reviews.title: TV has too many issues!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this tv, especially since I primarily use Prime Video for watching tv shows and movies. Out of the box, the tv seemed to work ok, but then it started flickering black horizontal lines across the screen. Also, it doesn't include Google Movies and TV, which I ocassionally use and the screen kinda seemed dark. Also, this specific tv is made exclusively by Best Buy, which might be why the tv seems to be cheap junk (Years ago I bought an Insiginia TV from Best Buy and it had the same flickering issues as this one), so I won't make that mistake again. I will be returning the tv and looking for another brand to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Evtrain

customer_reviews.title: Nice while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Bought one six months ago. Remote stopped working. Bought Insignia uni remote, but can only program if the TV is on. Can't locate input button even though I searched for it in customer questions and online. If the button is under the blue light, it doesn't work. It had a great picture and worked well until this happened. I'm so sick of TV's that only last six months and then die. I'd do anything for an old-fashioned TV right now.
customer_reviews.author: Woof2020

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had the same tv since 2009. We were way overdue for an upgrade and decided to splurge when this went on sale for prime day. It’s truly a great tv. It’s so nice to have all of our apps right on the tv without needing an Xbox or anything. The picture quality is great, the display is great, and overall this was an amazing deal! I’m very happy with the tv!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mostly great
customer_reviews.text: This TV is mostly great. I got it on Prime day, so the price point was fantastic (somewhere around $250 I think). However, after having it for 4 months the picture started to blip in and out every once in a while on the upper half of the screen. It's not frequent enough that it is a major issue, but I'm concerned the problem may progress in the future. The TV has good picture otherwise, and good sound quality. I almost feel no need for a sound bar or additional sound system, except when playing music with heavier bass.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Heitman

customer_reviews.title: Great TV for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I like that there is a piece of cardboard that I assume is to protect the screen, but it’s almost the exact size of the TV. I used it as a template to figure out where to mount it and how high. Cons... for a 50” TV they used a small bolt pattern to attach the wall mount. On the flip side, the TV is light, so you don’t need the larger bolt pattern. I only used sheetrock anchors and it is holding in just fine. The TV itself has a great image, the fire stick built in is great. The sound is stelar. Big sound from built in speakers. Over all it’s a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: 200 x 200 MM mount required
customer_reviews.text: I looked forever to find the back for this and turned up some incorrect information. I had a mount that held a 200 x 300MM and that is what the information I looked up said this was. IT IS NOT THAT! It is 200x200. Otherwise, the TV is super great. Good picture, I like the multiple HDMI and that it opens right to the Fire TV experience. It runs way more quickly than other smart tvs i've had (and faster than my regular fire tv). Highly recommend this product, it's the right price point for what it delivers :)
customer_reviews.author: mystic dirk

customer_reviews.title: WORST PURCHASE EVER
customer_reviews.text: This tv SUCKS, I bought it because I like to game on my pc with a large screen and well what would you know the HDCP blocks my pcs input and I had to buy a splitter to bypass the HDCP but now my splitter doesnt seem to be bypassing it anymore so I have to upgrade another 40 bucks into a new splitter just to see my freaking input! I'm getting ready to contact amazon and have this crap returned because who has 40 bucks everytime this TV thinks my device is a hazard. HDCP should be optional!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bianca Li

customer_reviews.title: Awesome TV if you are in the Amazon Enviroment
customer_reviews.text: The whole Alexa and Amazon Prime integration is awesome. It even has a live TV function and TV guide if you have Amazon's HBO, STARZ or other subscriptions. I love that the input selections are part of the Menu. So in my case I have Direct TV on HDMI one, when you highlight it in the onscreen menu, it shows you live what is on that Input without even selecting it. Very Pleased with the Purchase, 43" version, and you can't beat the price
customer_reviews.author: David P

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level, inexpensive smart TV for budget minded people not too picky about image quality
customer_reviews.text: Great entry level, basic viewing smart TV. Reasonable picture quality for a low end smart TV making it great for people on a budget. Controls are easy to use. Alexa enabled. There is some blurring with movement but great for a kid's room or just everyday cable, satellite, or streaming services. Not for the discerning videophile or someone who demands darker blacks, no image lag, and defined outlines of much better made BUT FAR more expensive sets. Would probably buy another for the spare bedroom, but not the primary TV for company, quality movies, ball games, etc. But, still all in all a quality TV for basic needs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pieper

customer_reviews.title: TV is awesome........ shipping was horrible
customer_reviews.text: The TV is awesome but the shipping and handling.....not so much. Not to mention, it was delivered and dropped off upside down. I started to give this review one star but the TV itself seems to be in perfect working condition and there's no obvious damage. The week-long delay in shipping was a disaster. Both Best Buy and UPS had no legitimate reason for it besides it was just left at the warehouse. I say all of that to say this: you'll get the TV eventually, rather it works or not once you do is 50/50 based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Chance Ill

customer_reviews.title: No volume leveling = LOUD COMMERCIALS
customer_reviews.text: No volume leveling means this TV is useless with Directv or AT&T. The volume fluctuations, especially during commercials, are outrageous. I understand this has been an issue with Directv for years, but all of my other TVs and devices surpress lots volume fluctuations to a tolerable level. This TV does none of that, so commercials are easily 3x the volume of the accompanying program. It's incredibly frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: really great purchase (unless you like Alexa)
customer_reviews.text: **update** The fire app is a “lite” version of fire tv. There are some basic features like pairing with other Alexa devices that it won’t support. Ended up having to buy an extra fire stick which defeated the whole purpose. I love that the remote is the TV remote and fire stick. No need to have separate remotes. I also really enjoy how easy it is to transition from different apps and built-in Alexa. I use Bluetooth headphones at night so not to make too much noise, and the pairing process is a pain. I wish Alexa could connect them.
customer_reviews.author: Luke H

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup. Beautiful and big picture
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parents because they’re in their late 60’s and early 70’s and they really love it. I love it too so I’ll be over at their house on game days. It’s very user friendly and simple to setup and use. Note: They have Xfinity so I connected their cable box with an HDMI cord but when setting it up, I made the mistake of trying to scan for channels. Turns out, you just have to go to settings and change the input to HDMI in order to switch to cable. Just adding that because I made the mistake and couldn’t really find help on that simple fix. But it’s super easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love the ability to control with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, especially in conjunction with Alexa. Finding movies, tv shows and adding apps is easy. The only problem I have had is that sometimes the sound decreases in volume while watching a streaming service like Netflix or Prime = mostly after a program is paused. The volume gradually returns to the proper level. I have tried working with Amazon and Best Buy service departments and done everything suggested to "solve " the problem but it is to no avail. Luckily it happens infrequently - i'll live with it
customer_reviews.author: Jeff F

customer_reviews.title: Lack of clarity and Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Bought this during a holiday deal. Love the Firetv built in. Very easy to get started. This being my first smart TV am finding a breakup in the picture sometimes as far as clarity. However, that might be because I need a higher speed for internet now. I'll be officially cutting the cord and changing the internet speed. Alexa voice control has also only worked about 50% of the time. It comes up as unavailable. Still happy, but it might just be because I'm one step closer to saving $200 a month.
customer_reviews.author: DAGoerig

customer_reviews.title: A highly recommended TV!
customer_reviews.text: I came to this TV from a Panasonic Plasma. It did take a bit to get used to the screen. Like the brightness and color. After all it is a very nice TV and worth the price. I love that Amazon TV is built right in. Very clean looking and not heavy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn B

customer_reviews.title: Died in 2 months.  Boot loop.
customer_reviews.text: What can you say good about a TV that died in 2 months of light use? I have a device that is stuck in a boot loop (google insignia boot loop). Tried power reset, unplugged overnight, long-press power menu to clear cache, factory reset....many times. All failed. 2 months. I suspect a system update was pushed out, and killed the machine. E-Waste pickup is in 2 weeks, guess I give them this. Don't waste your money. I just got a Visio 4k 50 inch to replace it, so far it is much better experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ian E. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: I haven't bought a new TV since 2008, so this is a huge upgrade for me. The 50 inch uses a 200x200 for mounting it on the wall and it's fairly light for its size. It came with basic instructions for assembly. If you're used to Amazon Fire TV, it operates exactly like that. It works great with my over-the-air channels (I only get 7, but it's wild to me that it shows the TV guide-type programming for those channels, even though I use an antenna). I'm impressed with this TV and would get it again.
customer_reviews.author: VG

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It's a great TV with only the popular apps, such as Amazon Prime, Netflix, Hulu and so on. If you want a TV with just those apps and a few more, this one is good. I like the remote control because I can just command it to play music from Amazon music or play a TV show from Amazon Prime or Hulu. But if you want more apps, I would suggest buying a Roku stick for 30 bucks and connect it to one of the HDMI ports.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. ATop Contributor: Pianos

customer_reviews.title: Good TV. Crazy loud commercial volume.
customer_reviews.text: Good all around inexpensive smart tv. One big problem - commercial volume is insanely loud. Not the normal usual obnoxious volume increase, but like triple the volume. I hope this is something that can be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonSam

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturers defect and terrible customer support.
customer_reviews.text: Just brought this TV in March and the panel is screwed. Turns out it's a manufacturers defect. Trying to get this TV replaced or repaired has been HELL! I had been calling support since March and finally got through at the end of July. I've been transferred to 3 different departments just to get the exchange finalized. No one has made any effort to contact me about when or how this exchange will take place. Terrible!
customer_reviews.author: Mommybuyer

customer_reviews.title: After a few months, everything is still great
customer_reviews.text: This is basically like a Large tablet! This is our first TV like this. We can watch regular tv or watch the Apps like it's a smart phone. The apps (along with the remote) are a bit clumsy. But overall you can use alexa to speak into the remote. I prefer the navigation of my regular ole Comcast but this truly gives you so much more. I haven't 'cut the cord' yet. We have a family with pre teen kids so regular tv still good for us, but they (kids) probably wouldn't miss it much. Picture quality is superb, especially for the pricE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: MeanMike

customer_reviews.title: Good Resolution, Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: The images are Sharp and precise although sometimes there's a quick smudge of color as it keeps up with action movies. The sound is incredible. The Smart features are good. I'm not using the voice recognition features so have no comment on that. It's a great size for viewing UHD films as I feel right there with the action. I'd recommend this if you, like me, watch much more Prime, Netflix, or Hulu than live TV. It's quite handy and the picture is good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible
customer_reviews.text: Dull color, slow processor, toggling between apps and loading apps are so slow, lag lag flickering and wait to load is what you are paying for, horrendous firetv panel with advertisements, user hostile navigation, poorly designed remote, cannot customize smart buttons, not compatible with universal remotes, TV will ALWAYS return to the fireTV panel and not remember to stay on Apple TV or HDMI port,, power and volume cannot be learned by any other remote so you will always need to have 2 remotes, can only connect to 2.4G. Returned in 48 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Franz

customer_reviews.title: Good until not
customer_reviews.text: I love the TV until it would not leave the Prime Video screen. It happened when I first got the TV in March 2020. Somehow I got it working again. This time it has been about a week. It will not go to the TV’s home screen. It goes back to Prime Video. I decided to watch a movie on Prime and it would not allow that. It just went back to the main screen on Prime. I have reached out twice to Best Buy with no reply. I am getting upset not being able to relax before bed watching TV in my family room with a new TV.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Agathen

customer_reviews.title: Alexa Controls It Well
customer_reviews.text: This is a nifty TV. I can control it through Alexa, or use the remote control. Alexa can do basic features, on/off, volume, channel or input select, but its slower than using the remote. One of the things that Alexa can do, that the remote control can’t, is rewind or fast-forward an exact number of minutes. I find this feature to be very useful! Especially on Hulu, where those features leave something to be desired. On the flipside, one of the things the remote can do that Alexa can’t, is select which account to use within Hulu or Netflix (or at least I haven’t found a way to do it).
customer_reviews.author: Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: Good picture, nothing else.
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is good but the rest is bad. First this TV is adware so if you don't like ads don't buy. It is always the first thing you will see and also the WiFi does not stay on you have to reset the TV just to avoid having to type your password Everytime. It is like every other time you turn it on tho.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects constantly
customer_reviews.text: This TV disconnects from the internet almost every time I use it. The only apps that seem to work are Prime and Netflix. Everything else loses connection. And most TV apps forget your login info so you have to log in and verify your TV provider every time. It also has a pitiful amount of memory, so if you don’t know how to add more memory, you’ll have to be satisfied having only a few apps.
customer_reviews.author: BlueAngel43

customer_reviews.title: great tv for the price
customer_reviews.text: great picture and great features and fire tv built is great and the options to pause live tv without a dvr or cable box is real cool if i had to complain is led back lights
customer_reviews.author: Robert edwards

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS TV - Only Lasted 15 Months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this march 2019, 15 months later in June 2020 it just completely stopped working. Called Insignia directly, concluded it was likely toast, but there was nothing they would do because it's after the 12 month manufacturer's warranty, so in the trash it goes. Spend a few extra bucks for a brand that isn't garbage, buying an Insignia product is the same as throwing your money away.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: The fire TV can be a little bit challenging at first,
customer_reviews.text: I love this TV the picture is absolutely great the fire TV works great although they fire can be a little bit a challenging if you're not familiar with the fire TV at first once you conquer it you'll love it
customer_reviews.author: cartconnection

customer_reviews.title: AWESOMESAUCE!
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING PRODUCT! I am very pleased with the volume which is very loud on this TV. You can go to the settings and change that and also the viewing. I have absolutely no complaints that came in perfect condition I hung it myself with my 86 year-old mother's help I even programmed my Dish remote by myself. Proud of me go girl power! You will not be disappointed this is plenty more bang for your buck $300 for a 50 inch TV unbelievable! Thank you, Insigna!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Gardner

customer_reviews.title: All in on Fire
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a non smart tv that was struck by lightning. Paired with the Recast, this tv has made the cord cutting fairly easy ( if only we could find an inexpensive way to get some sport channels). I think the picture is as good if not better than the previous 10 year old $1000+ lg tv it replace, for a fraction of the money. I have no regrets with the purchase of this tv after the first 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Ben M

customer_reviews.title: So Far Very Good
customer_reviews.text: They almost scared me in the removal video like its sooo fragile that you can barely touch it. Once it arrived I was careful to not touch the screen. Oh they say you have to have 2 people to unpack it but I was just fine. Once I got it out I attached the legs and then put it on the stand. It works great so far have Direct TV and even though what others have said when you turn it on it actually pops up an input selection and it is very easy to choose from, overall so far I love it we will see...
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Pederson

customer_reviews.title: Great price! Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great TV! Gorgeous picture overall with exceptional images! Sound system is clear and concise. Easy to setup! This particular television has a built in Alexa, which helps find what you want quickly. Also, you can't beat the price! This 4k television is also great for gaming! I would highly recommend this television to anyone!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Loads and loads of bugs
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst tv I’ve ever purchased. I own another Insignia tv that’s not Amazon and it works perfectly after 3 years. This tv hasn’t even lasted a year. It does bizarre things all the time. I have to constantly clear caches from apps to avoid it from freezing up. Now, before the year mark, the tv needs to be unplugged to restart every morning or it just won’t work. Thought I was getting a deal and I very much regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra S. French

customer_reviews.title: 55 Inch Slow to Boot
customer_reviews.text: The 55 inch model, purchased in November, 2019, is slow to turn on; some times we get so tired of waiting that we keep pushing the on-off button on the remote, causing more delay. In general, a good buy for the money. This issue is compounded by no indication that the TV is booting. There should be a clear indication on the TV that it is booting.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Really good TV
customer_reviews.text: Screen is great. Sound is good. Size is outstanding for the price. I only have 2 complaints. Can't use Alexa to set a sleep timer, so it's fairly wonky to set a sleep timer on it. The other is that if you make an announcement in your house using your amazon echo, this TV also turns on and makes the announcement. I changed the Alexa settings to get it to stop turning on when it is off, but they don't work. Overall, these are minor issues. I'm very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Big Willie

customer_reviews.title: Horrible TV DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this television in July of 2019. It is June 25, 2020 and the TV just stopped working. Not even 1 year and now I have a 50 inch piece of junk hanging on my wall. I will attempt to contact either Insignia or Best Buy’s customer service tomorrow and will update my review afterwards. To say I am disappointed in this product is a huge understatement.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: COMPLETELY AMAZING AT A AMAZING PRICE!!
customer_reviews.text: I ONLY PAID $250 FOR A 50 INCH 4K SMART TV AND I FEEL LIKE IT WAS THE BEST PURCHASE IN MY ENTIRE LIFE NOW AFTER DOING SO!! Usually 4K Smart TV’s from other brands range between $400-$1000 and they sometimes dont even have smart capabilities. The picture quality is 10/10! Like I completely love it with all the different settings and stuff for it!
customer_reviews.author: Kas Havok

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS TV IF YOU HAVE XFINITY
customer_reviews.text: THIS TV DOES NOT WORK WITH XFINITY! DO NOT BUY! DO NOT USE! TELL INSIGNIA TO FIX THIS! XFINITY WILL NOT FIX THE ISSUE!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: lildaleksec

customer_reviews.title: Nice TV without the separate streaming box or stick
customer_reviews.text: This works exactly like a fire TV box or stick, but it's built in. The only thing I don't like, which is the same issue I had with the fire tv box, is it comes with pre-installed Amazon programs that you can't uninstall, such as "Freetime" and "Game circle" that we don't use. Hopefully we won't start getting the "uninstall apps" popup error on this like we did the box.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley P.

customer_reviews.title: Sounds lags on the apps
customer_reviews.text: All the apps on this tv , the sound lags. Confusing when a mans voice is coming from a woman The dvd does fine .
customer_reviews.author: maro

customer_reviews.title: garbage with receivers or other Amazon devices
customer_reviews.text: The remote here looks like a fire stick remote however it will not manage receivers or pair with other devices, meaning that it's great for a guest room but if you have blu ray, game consoles or just want surround sound you'll have to deal with multiple remotes to handle everything. Spending an hour on the phone with tech support we were unable to setup audio out from the tv to a receiver either. 0/5 stars would not recommend to anyone until they figure out better compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: tejasmike

customer_reviews.title: Internet connection
customer_reviews.text: This TV is junk. At first it connected to internet just fine. Now now matter what I do it won't connect to the internet. It is right next to the router. Absolute waste of money. I should have believed the poor reviews before I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Ardee

customer_reviews.title: Best 4K TV you’ll find for under $300
customer_reviews.text: Picture: Above average. Beautiful color. Sound: Above average. No sound bar needed unless you want Surround Sound. Smart TV features: (I’m biased because I owned a Fire TV stick before purchasing this TV) The Apps Menus are easy to navigate and Alexa works great. Overall, I highly recommend this TV if you want a great TV at a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Manda H

customer_reviews.title: 5-star product and for the price, unbeatable
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product for the money. The definition is great and the connectivity/smart features are quick and extremely user friendly. The only thing I’ve noticed is when you are watching something and the color on the screen is almost entirely black, it looks a tiny bit blotchy, but only for nearly all black scenes. Not a big deal at all but wanted people to know. Definitely a 5-star product and for the price, unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I like the Amazon Fire interface, But that’s about it. It does have great picture. My problem is it is sooo glitchy. Apps are constantly not working, have to restart them or force stop them all the time. It freezes up all the time, usually just a few seconds but frustrating. Always running out of memory for apps. I expected better from Amazon, that’s why we went with this one instead of a Roku one.
customer_reviews.author: J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Large and clear
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son because he wanted a larger TV to use in the living room of his apartment at college. He was very surprised and loved that it was a smart TV. When I asked him about it, he said it was super easy to set up and has a great picture. I bought this on prime day so it was a great deal. Would recommend, even without the sales price.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Worked For One Year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this TV on July 23, 2019. Today (August 18, 2020), the screen went black. There is still sound but no picture except for an occasional faded glimmer. I am aware it’s not a high-end brand but I expected more longevity. I bought it to replace a 720P Panasonic I had since 2011 that still runs perfectly. Disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amani Jay

customer_reviews.title: Screen display is defective
customer_reviews.text: We have only had the TV out of the box for 6 days and it has developed a vertical green line right down the center of the screen. We are two days past the 30-day return window so now we have a headache on our hands trying to go through warranty :(
customer_reviews.author: W. Luers

customer_reviews.title: So So....
customer_reviews.text: Resolution is not what you should expect from a 4K. And TV commercial volume SPIKES at times. No volume leveling function. And I turned off the dialog enhancement. Still no help. Many Google threads on this issue. I have never had this issue on any other flat screens purchased. Not on a TCl or Vizio.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: No help at customer service
customer_reviews.text: Bought this tv, has great picture and sound, had some difficulty hooking up to my cable box, called customer service at number provided. Call went to Best Buy, waited only 15 minutes which was fine. The service rep only wanted to schedule a tech visit for $149. I got a little ticked off at this , when all she needed to do was guide me back to the set up steps and confirm I overlooked one step. When I started back at step one it took less then a minute to get cable box online. Tv works great but the the customer service sux
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K

customer_reviews.title: Great tv that responds quickly.
customer_reviews.text: TV has great quality and the tv responds very quickly to the remote. Has lots of apps, even Crunchyroll! Highly recommend... 10/19/20 Update: TV developed a vertical line that is always there. I called customer support and finally they told me I'm SOL. I've had it a little less than a year and a half. When I was in retail Insignia had a 2 year warranty. Not any more. Tv is wall mounted and never been hit or dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Bomb dot com but,
customer_reviews.text: All the ladies I’ve had over since buying this TV have all said nice things. It’s not overly big, it’s just right. I just have one little issue but don’t have the time to write about it.
customer_reviews.author: GenericAmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great TV! Great Pic! Easy to Use! Get One!
customer_reviews.text: It’s fantastic! It’s got verything you could possibly need in a TV! ....And then some. Voice recognition with Alexa works perfect all features are easy to find and use, which to me is paramount. It sits nicely on the surface and has super grip pads to keep it from sliding. I like this TV a whole lot!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Anne

customer_reviews.title: WORST CRAP ON THE MARKET....DIDN'T LAST 90 DAYS ---STAY AWAY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I SHOULD HAVE READ THE REVIEWS MORE CLOSELY...BEST BUY NOT RESPONDING. THIS INSIGNIA TV IS TERRIBLE..AFTER 90 DAYS, LINES ARE RUNNING THROUGH THE WHOLE SCREEN. OTHERS COMPLAINED ABOUT IT , BUT BEST BUY JUST KEEPS SELLING THEM. i DIDN'T BUY THE EXTRA PROTECTION BECAUSE I'VE NEVER HAD A PROBLEM BEFORE....BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for cable cutters
customer_reviews.text: Dropped cable so watching everything through the internet and this tv is near perfect. Love that 1 remote controls everything unlike my older TVs where I have to turn it on with tv remote then find the fire remote. My only complaint & reason for 4 stars is that both fire tv & fire tv stick drops the WiFi a lot & I have to restart the router. It’s only the fire products with this issue.
customer_reviews.author: janet

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Best value and fantastic package.
customer_reviews.text: So impressed! For $250, I got an amazing TV. This thing feels premium versus my premium Samsung TV. Like metal rather than plastic. The built-in Fire TV works fast and beautifully! As well as the 4k stick for sure. And the sound, WOW! It has built in Dolby and I can tell! No need for a sound bar as this already has a low-mid range sound bar essentially.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan House

customer_reviews.title: Super pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 smart TVs. This is my first non major name purchase. I have not been as pleased as I am with my Insignia Fire TV with any of my last 3 smart TVs. The picture is clearer than I imagined it could be and the audio... without the Bluetooth speaker system I have, is out of this world. I do not have... One...not ONE complaint with this tv. Infact I need a second tv for my master bedroom and that was the reason I clicked on this link. I am definitely super pleased with this purchase!❤️🧡💛💚💙
customer_reviews.author: CJ Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Major Problems with Memory and Storage!!
customer_reviews.text: Would be great, if it didn't keep throwing up a storage error. I only have two installed apps that are ones that I CAN uninstall, so I'm guessing it's a thumbnail issue?? If that's the case, they should have somewhere easily accessible that I can delete those and/or let me move everything to the memory stick I installed - only two of the apps I had were able to transfer to the stick I bothered to buy... because...no idea. I loved this TV before this started. I'd bought two of them. Now I don't think I want another Fire TV ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: High quality TV
customer_reviews.text: I got this TV on sale (don't remember how much I paid) and I'm highly satisfied with it. The image quality is very good and it's got Amazon Prime, Netflix and a bunch of other things. You can even download a bunch of free little games through Amazon. My 12 year old loves that.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo Rubio

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't power on first time out the box
customer_reviews.text: So far so bad. Unboxed and legs put on per manufacturer's instructions. Went to power it on and NOTHING. Tried the remote and power button on TV. Waiting on a response from seller and will update after that.
customer_reviews.author: HD

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love how simple and easy it is to set this tv up. The picture quality is great. It’s also super convenient to have access to prime, Netflix and YouTube and everything else I use all in one location. Not to mention I love the Alexa feature, it is always finding things for me that I would never scroll long enough to discover on my own. Easy to use, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jackson

customer_reviews.title: A lot of Apps that should work isn't available
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed to find out a lot of APPS that I expected to work doesn't such as Sling, CBS All Access and more. If you try downloading these it will say unavailable and that it is available with a fire remote. I am guessing this is a ploy to get us to buy a fire remote and get prime to get some of these channels. Now the home button on the remote is not working. If I could do it again I would not buy this TV. My TCL was so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Bought thia tv on sale and firstly I was happy when it was working. However it developed a dead line across the screen after a few weeks. I returned to best buy and it was an easy process. The tv was extremely bright and I could not find a brightness option. So it was a little intense at night. Hopefully these smart TVs can bring some red light filters or auto dimming soon
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Waggoner

customer_reviews.title: I havent even opened the box yet
customer_reviews.text: I don't know actually have not even opened the Box.. yet.. I found to be more useful to hold my keys ,cup, lighter ,fan remote,wd-40 ,and Dr Pepper. Notice the nice area to hold my random items. Easily accessible. Lulz.
customer_reviews.author: TeX HeX

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS TV, WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tv 15 months ago. It was pretty good until today, there was a loud POP and the screen went black. After only 15 months! I called Insignia and was told "sorry, the back light has gone out, your warranty expired, approximate cost to fix,$150-200" Very disappointed. So happy Amazon is NOT carrying it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa O.

customer_reviews.title: Not User Friendly
customer_reviews.text: The tv has a mind of it's own and will turn off one program and go to a previous menu. There are blips in the streaming quality almost like clockwork on the half hour. When fastforwarding or rewinding it will decide that the program can't be rewound or fastforwarded when it worked previously.
customer_reviews.author: LRB

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about it so far, except the small blue light in the bottom left that turns on when the tv turns off. It makes sleeping in the same room as the tv very hard. I taped two blue sticky notes over the light and it filters most of it out while still allowing the controller to work.
customer_reviews.author: Review

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly but good picture
customer_reviews.text: So, we like this tv. We’re mostly streamers. The picture is gorgeous. Our issue is that the tv is sort of wobbly on its legs. Didn’t know if anyone else experienced that issue or not.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: It’s crappy
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money , after 6 months , nothing but problems ! And Amazon Sells it through Best Buy and neither one of them will hold up to their bargain of either refunding or replacing it I’ve gone to the manufacturer they sent me back to Best Buy Best Buy again will not even look at the television thank God I got a four year contract on it and hopefully they will send a technician out to take care of it don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smart Tv for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: Great vivid picture. The picture is stunning especially when viewing in 4K. The sound quality is great as well. My only issue I have is that the USB port doesn’t support media viewing unless it’s photos.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. RogersTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: HDR Feature
customer_reviews.text: How do you enable HDR on this TV? My gaming console says that the tv doesn't have HDR.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Tardy

customer_reviews.title: If you don’t have a fire stick don’t bother with this tv
customer_reviews.text: This tv gives me so much trouble the apps run slow and doesn’t stream properly. I try to sign into apps and it wants you to pay through amazon when I aleady have it set up through iTunes. I understand that’s it’s an amazon tv but you solely have to use their products in order for the tv to work I have a rocky tv that doesn’t give me any issues, I wish I never bought this thing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Using on my back patio. Fantastic value! Love having the smart features so I can watch netflix/amazon prime outside. Wish I could punch up the picture brightness a bit more as it can be hard to see if the sun is super bright. But really hard to complain, as overall this is great for the money!
customer_reviews.author: DSTX

customer_reviews.title: Product quality is #1 in my book
customer_reviews.text: Pro’s: Light Remote control ease of use Great picture Great sound No issues YET! Con’s TV was delivered in it’s manufacturer box (not an Amazon box encasing it like everything else they ship) and left damaged on my front porch (for the whole neighborhood to see)...fortunately no damage to the tv :) Summary: TV is working wonderfully, as long as it stays that way. Only problems were with the delivery. Hope all who purchase this TV have as good of an experience as I’ve had.
customer_reviews.author: Carey M.

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly.... this was a GREAT purchase. We have NO complaints at all, super easy setup and extremely clear picture.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Boykin

customer_reviews.title: Arrived damaged.  Purchased at store later.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged. A small female delivered it to my front floor, dropped it and rang the doorbell. I happened to be looking out and have a gated patio. Anyone happening along could have taken that box. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amina F.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I has been about a month and I’m pretty satisfied with the television. I like the integrated features. I feel like it has enhanced my HD antenna reception. I wish the hard drive capacity was more than 5Gs. I’m a little on the fence because I would have purchased a well known brand but I just couldn’t stomach the prices.
customer_reviews.author: Bran

customer_reviews.title: 4k, HDR10, Dolby for cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as I have been using a 720p plasma for 10+ years and have a PlayStation Pro. I can say you can tell the difference immensely when it comes to games with HDR and 4k support. The one thing I have noticed which may just be due to coming from a plasma to led is the colors start to look washed out at an angle if you are close, say 3-4 feet. Further away it's not as noticable. Also the built in fire runs better than my Fire TV (2nd gen) and fire TV (4k). For 279.99 this is a crazy good TV.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great! I'd give it 5 stars for value, 4.5 stars all around.
customer_reviews.text: Great value! Love the Fire TV. Was Lucky enough to get a great deal on this 50" for under $300. Shipping was fast, came in 2 days early. Worth every penny. 4k & HDR Doesn't quite compare to $600+ tvs but has amazing picture for the price! It is very fast and has simple navigation as well. Think firestick but 3x as fast! I give it 5 stars for value, but 4.5 stars for quality and performance all around.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: If I could give Insignia  a -10 stars, I would.  BUYERS BEWARE!!!
customer_reviews.text: The back light on the TV went out in less than a year. We have called and called, only to be placed on hold multiple times. At the time of this review, I have been on the phone with them for more than 2 hours!!! This is not counting at least 4 other times on hold for at least an hour. I will NEVER buy an Insignia TV again. Although, this is a Best Buy product there customer service is little to no help. I have been waiting for nearly a month to get this TV replaced under the manufactures warranty but NOTHING. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Best investment ever!! What a deal!
customer_reviews.text: Showed up on time! Quality is better than expected! I can’t believe the price was $80 off! I am very hard on my TVs because it’s on all the time!!! It was an easy set up process. Early birthday present but I’m gonna thrown in Xmas too cause it’s amazing! Would buy over and over!!!
customer_reviews.author: TLT

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: A month in and this tv is still doing great! Really like the Fire integration, saves in additional power cord needs for the Fire Stick! Just wish my cable remote would sync with it, but that’s minor!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad unit
customer_reviews.text: Received, unboxed, and setup went flawlessly. Unfortunately within an hour the television screen went black. All functions were still working (sound, Alexa, etc) yet nothing but a blank screen to watch. Hopefully it can be replaced, though Amazon is only offering a refund (which is less than the TVs current price)
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Varsell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use apps
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect condition. The voice recognition works great. Was easy to set up and download apps. Because of this TV I got rid of my satellite provider and only use the apps which cost less combined than a monthly satellite bill.
customer_reviews.author: Casaundra

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Was nervous of it coming in broken because some of the reviews but it came in perfectly! Super happy by the quality and available apps/shows. Prime could probably get a little better with their offerings but it’s good. I don’t have a cable box hooked up and solely use the apps or Netflix to watch and it’s worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra K

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy smart functions are horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Four months and all the “smart functions” are no longer functional. Won’t stay connected to internet takes forever to load. Starting and selecting hdmi takes about five minutes before the remote can scroll through the menu. Tv works fine when the Xbox is in control but the smart functions on this tv are the WORST I HAVE EVER SEEN. DO NOT BUY THIS TV!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly
customer_reviews.text: Ordered to give as gift for customer appreciation... have not given away yet, so can’t attest to quality. Arrived quickly, but box is beat up with rips and holes, so doesn’t look real pretty on display which probably isn’t that important to most.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 9 and 8 year olds room. Not disappointed, the voice control and smart features give them a great easily controlled tv.
customer_reviews.author: Jet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift for parents ~ easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my parents, easy set up and easy for them to learn how to go back-and-forth when streaming or watching DIRECTV, they love the talking feature for the streaming apps. The picture is extremely sharp they were very amazed by the quality of the picture
customer_reviews.author: Athena L.

customer_reviews.title: Practical Smart Tv for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this tv! I wanted to upgrade from my Roku to another tv that had more practical features and this Smart TV is a winner hands down! Picture and sound quality are superior and with the use of the Alexa app I can operate my Smart Home add-ons too! This was well worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: Aria

customer_reviews.title: Menu system is excruciatingly painful
customer_reviews.text: The menu is horrible, just like the reviews said. But i thought to myself, oh, im ONLY USING to connect to my switch and ps4 so it won't be a problem. I was wrong, it's still a huge problem, since theirs no source button on the controller, and you have to use the menu for everything. Picture quality nowhere close to what it should be either.
customer_reviews.author: Tia

product_meta.title: Insignia NS-50DF710NA19 50-inch Smart 4K UHD TV - Fire TV Edition
product_meta.description: The Insignia 4K UHD Smart TV is a new generation of televisions, featuring the Fire TV experience built-in and including a Voice Remote with Alexa. With true-to-life 4K Ultra HD picture quality and access to all the movies and TV shows you love, Toshiba Fire TV Edition delivers a superior TV experience that gets smarter every day. The Voice Remote with Alexa lets you do everything you'd expect from a remote—plus, easily launch apps, search for TV shows, play music, switch inputs, control smart home devices and more, using just your voice.
feature_bullets: Insignia 4K UHD Smart TV – Fire TV Edition delivers true-to-life 4K Ultra HD picture quality with over 8 million pixels for stunning clarity, deep contrast, and vivid colors.
With the Fire TV experience built-in, enjoy tens of thousands of channels, apps, and Alexa skills, including Disney+, Netflix, YouTube, Prime Video, Hulu, HBO, SHOWTIME, STARZ, and more
Fire TV Edition seamlessly integrates live over-the-air TV and streaming channels on a unified home screen (HD antenna required).
Easily control your TV with the included Voice Remote with Alexa—plus, launch apps, search for titles, play music, switch inputs, control smart home devices, and more, using just your voice.

Dimensions (W x H x D): TV without stand: 44.4” x 26.1” x 3.3”, TV with stand: 44.4” x 27.8” x 10.4”. Multiple device input/output options: 3 HDMI including 1 with ARC, USB, composite input, antenna/cable input, digital output (optical), audio output, Ethernet.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,003 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
